policies.involuntary_refund:
A full refund is allowed if:
• The flight is canceled
• The schedule is changed by 3 or more hours
• Full refund via GDS is accepted in case of flight cancellation and if the schedule change is higher than 3 hours. FULL PNR history with the UN/SC segments and ticket numbers must be sent to usa@apg-ga.us for review and waiver.
policies.involuntary_reissue:
In case of schedule change ≥3 hours or flight cancellation (UN/SC segments):
• If new flight suits passenger and is same RBD → reissue without fees, add ENDO: SKCHG (schedule change) or INVOL (irregular op)
• If new flight suits passenger but not same RBD → send FULL PNR history to usa@apg-ga.us showing who added the new flight
• If no suitable flight or original canceled (UN) → penalty waived, reissue on same route/RBD/carrier, collect ADC (rerouting if fare rules allow)
• APG will not pay compensation, hotel, transfers, meals, etc.
• If disruption on other ticket affects GP-275 → no full refund, but ONE FREE CHANGE before departure applies
• If status is HX → must contact usa@apg-ga.us
policies.voluntary_refund:
• Fare rules of the operating carrier apply
• Penalties collected via CP tax code
• If multiple carriers involved on 275 ticket, apply most restrictive rule
VOLUNTARY REISSUANCE (until further notice):
• ONE FREE CHANGE before departure (for completely unused tickets)
  → Only penalties waived
  → ADC (fare/tax difference) must be collected
  → Add ENDO: ONEFREECHANGE
• From 2nd change onward → operating airline fare rules apply
• No full refund unless fare rules allow
• Rerouting only if fare rules permit
• Coupons must be used in sequence
policies.medical_refund:
Refund not applicable for medical reasons.
Instead:
• ONE FREE CHANGE before departure (for completely unused tickets)
  → Only penalties waived
  → ADC (fare/tax difference) must be collected
  → Add ENDO: ONEFREECHANGE
• From 2nd change onward → operating airline fare rules apply
• No full refund unless fare rules allow
• Rerouting only if fare rules permit
• Coupons must be used in sequence
policies.name_change:
Name corrections permitted for the same passenger only (not transferable).
Steps:
1. Create a new booking with correct name (same RBD or higher)
2. Issue a new ticket on GP-275
3. Notify APG with the new ticket number to usa@apg-ga.us
4. APG will provide a waiver for refund of the original ticket
• A $25 penalty applies to all name corrections.
policies.infant_policy:
All infant and child travel rules follow the operating carrier’s policy.
• Ensure proper SSR codes are included in the booking
• If baggage allowance for infants is required, confirm directly with the operating carrier prior to departure
policies.baggage_policy:
For baggage restrictions or special allowances, refer to your GDS or contact the operating carrier.
GP-275 tickets include baggage delay insurance via Blue Ribbon Bags:
• If a bag is not delivered within 96h, client may be eligible for compensation.
→ Submit at: https://apgiet.blueribbonbags.com/
policies.seat_request_policy:
Seat assignments, mobility assistance, and special meal requests are handled directly by the operating carrier.
• APG does not process special service requests for interline segments
• All ancillary service inquiries must be directed to the operating airline
policies.short_term_cancellation_policy: Voiding allowed on day of issuance only. After that, standard refund/reissue policies apply according to fare rules and waiver eligibility.
